refnamediv.refpurpose: homogenize all the bars included in the current working axes

listitem.para: (optional), a real scalar, defines the width (a percentage of the available room) for the bar (default: 0.8).

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: If there are several bar calls, the barhomogenize function allows to homogenize the width and style of all bars (i.e which has the polyline_style type 6) included in the current working axes. These bars must have the same x data.
barhomogenize( ) : takes the default values, h=gca(), width=0.8, style='grouped'.
barhomogenize(h,...) : defines the current axes where the drawing is performed.
barhomogenize(...,width,...) : defines the width of the bar(s) in percentage (generally: 0<width<=1).
barhomogenize(...,style,...) : defines how the bars are drawn. The 'grouped' option allows to center the M polylines versus each components of x, and the 'stacked' option allows to stack them.
